Hi,
Iâ€™d like to ask for a feature thatâ€™s very helpful and would be easy to implement.

When quoting a message to reply to it, a bubble with the message selected will appear on top of the message box (1). When clicking on it (1), it should move the message list to the respective message, and highlight it (2).

This is the link to the issue:

When quoting a message and clicking on the selected quote doesn't redirect to the message

opened 12:33PM - 28 Dec 21 UTC
closed 03:41PM - 03 Jan 22 UTC
tiagogaspar8

- [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] I am submittinâ€¦g a bug report for existing functionality that does not work as intended - [x] I have read https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports - [x] This isn't a feature request or a discussion topic (I believe it is not) ---------------------------------------- ### Bug description When quoting a message to reply to it, a bubble with the message selected will appear on top of the message box (1). When clicking on it (1), it should move the message list to the respective message, and highlight it (2). ### Steps to reproduce - Select a message to reply by swiping right on top of one - When the message is selected the keyboard should open and a bubble with chosen message appears - Click on the bubble with the message above the keyboard - Nothing happens **Actual result:** No redirection/highlight is made on the selected message **Expected result:** The message list should roll to the quoted message and highlight it. ### Screenshots ![signal-2021-12-28-12-29-35-332.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39808643/147566411-3a750bda-0f0b-4c94-80b5-52ae78f33bd3.jpg) ### Device info **Device:** OnePlus 8 **Android version:** 11 (Oxygen OS 11.0.10.10.IN21BA) **Signal version:** 5.28.8 ### Link to debug log I believe there are no logs I can't provide here, if there are please let me know!

Btw, I see youâ€™re a moderator, and since Iâ€™m new you can direct me to the correct place. I wanted to post a request, even maybe help implement IPv6 in this community forum, where can I post that/who should I contact? Thanks

Yes, I know what youâ€™re saying .

I use the quote function constantly. I canâ€™t reproduce your bug. I even tried it in multiple conversations on two different instances of Signal on Android. Every time I tap a quote box it jumps to the corresponding message.

Edit: Dumb question, but are you sending the message before you tap the quote box or tapping the quote box before itâ€™s sent and expecting to jump to the original message? Because I donâ€™t think the latter is the intended design.

posts.cooked:
Iâ€™m not a moderator or a Signal employee, just an enthusiast, so donâ€™t assume any traction based on the attention the post is getting .

As far as doing anything on the forum with IPv6, I donâ€™t have any information on that, but I do know the forum is run on a platform called Discourse, and Discourse offers a full-service option for managing all the back-end stuff, so they might be the ones that would handle that.

I doubt forum users can contribute to Signalâ€™s Discourse instance in any meaningful way. Hopefully a mod can correct me if Iâ€™m way off.

So coming back to this thread, I realize that I misunderstood the initial post. I read it a bit too quickly and thought you were talking about messages that had been sent, but I now see that you were talking about quotes that are still unsent. In that case, no, it isnâ€™t a bug (because the devs intentionally didnâ€™t design it that way) and a feature request is appropriate, as you have done here.
